item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Wordsworth
item.description: "The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless unremembered acts of kindness and love." -- William Wordsworth

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Every individual has a place to fill in the world and is important in some respect, whether he chooses to be so or not." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Reflect upon your present blessings -- of which every man has many -- not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Euripides
item.description: "It is a good thing to be rich and strong, but it is a better thing to be loved." -- Euripides

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Live to the point of tears." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Plato
item.description: "We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light." -- Plato

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "There's a time for departure even when there's no certain place to go." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Lisa add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Fellini
item.description: "There is no end. There is no beginning. There is only the infinite passion of life. " -- Fellini

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "And the trouble is, if you don't risk anything, you risk even more." -- Erica Jong

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Look on every exit as being an entrance somewhere else." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry Ward Beecher
item.description: "The art of being happy lies in the power of extracting happiness from common things." -- Henry Ward Beecher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "It is better to know some of the questions than all of the answers." -- James Thurber

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Agatha Christi
item.description: "I like living. I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow; but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing." -- Agatha Christi

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "When a person doesnâ€™t have gratitude, something is missing in his or her humanity. A person can almost be defined by his or her attitude toward gratitude." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Thich Nhat Hanh
item.description: "Because you are alive, everything is possible." -- Thich Nhat Hanh

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "Man's mind, once stretched by a new idea, never regains its original dimensions." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
